description: Aspose.CAD is a library for working with CAD file formats. The library allows to export CAD drawings into Pdfs or any other raster image format. The library has a large scalable and easy to use API, it is a cross platform solution and performs CAD processing using the same set of algorithms for different platforms. Unlike other solutions does not require AutoCAD to be installed and is a fully managed solution.
releaseNotes:
Aspose.CAD for .Net public release version 17.09.0 and we are pleased to announce it.
      The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.CAD.

      New Features:
      CADNET-186 Support for IFC format
      CADNET-380 Implement support for STL format

      Enhancements:
      CADNET-292 When DXF is converted to PDF, output files has 3 pages instead of 1.
      CADNET-294 Converting DXF to PDF is splitting image on multiple pages in PDF
      CADNET-338 Incorrect image size for DWF
      CADNET-381 Difference between rendered PDF and Image
      CADNET-382 ImageException on exporting DWG to PDF
      CADNET-336 Text missing when DWG is exported to PDF
      CADNET-301 Layer not visible when saving dwg as jpg
      CADNET-293 DXF to PDF conversion is producing very small shapes in resultant PDF
      CADNET-288 Blank area when saving dwg as image and pdf
      CADNET-272 Converting DXF to PDF is generating incorrect PDF file (text missing and multiple pages)
      CADNET-199 Converting DWG to PDF format is producing incorrect PDF file of empty pages
      CADNET-178 Support export option which automatically excludes empty layouts
      CADNET-296 Fix bug with shift of drawing on layouts
      CADNET-175 Converting DXF to PDF is not producing correct results: Incorrect color and orientation of text

      Public API changes:
	  CADNET-186 Support for IFC format
      CADNET-380 Implement support for STL format
      CADNET-293 DXF to PDF conversion is producing very small shapes in resultant PDF

      Please note that Aspose.CAD product was split from Aspose.Imaging product and hence its public API is almost the same so you can easily migrate to Aspose.CAD by renaming your using namespaces to Aspose.CAD instead of Aspose.Imaging.

The library has a large scalable and easy to use API, it is a cross platform solution and performs CAD processing using the same set of algorithms for different platforms. Unlike other solutions does not require AutoCAD to be installed and is a fully managed solution.
title: Aspose.CAD for .NET
